seller_tips.introduction: Here you will find Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) about selling on GarvelBids ("we," "us," or "our") website, [garvelbids.com], and related services (collectively, the "Site"). If you have any questions that are not addressed here, please feel free to contact us.

categories.title: 1. What types of items are suitable for auction?
categories.content: Items that are rare, unique, collectible, or of high quality are best suited for auction. These can include fine art, jewelry, antiques, classic cars, luxury watches, designer furniture, rare comics, and other specialist collectibles. Everyday, mass-produced, or low-value items generally are not accepted as they do not attract enough interest from bidders.

categories.title: 2. How do I ensure my items are accepted?
categories.content: To maximize the chances of your item being accepted, ensure that it fits within our approved categories and meets standards of authenticity, quality, and rarity. Always provide clear, accurate descriptions and multiple high-quality photographs. Avoid submitting items in poor condition, replicas, or incomplete sets. The more information you provide about the item’s background and authenticity, the higher the likelihood of acceptance.

categories.title: 3. How should I present my items?
categories.content: Your item presentation should be as professional as possible. Use a descriptive title that highlights the key features, such as the brand, year, or unique qualities. Write a detailed description that includes size, material, condition, provenance, and any special features. Upload sharp, well-lit photos from different angles, and if possible, include close-ups of hallmarks, maker’s marks, or any relevant details that can assure authenticity.

categories.title: 4. What makes an item attractive to bidders?
categories.content: Bidders are particularly drawn to items that are authentic, well-documented, and in excellent condition. Certificates of authenticity, original packaging, or provenance documentation significantly increase trust and desirability. Rarity also plays a big role—items that are hard to find or limited in production usually attract more competitive bidding. Clear, professional photographs and a well-written description make your listing stand out among others.

categories.title: 5. Are there items I cannot sell?
categories.content: Yes, some items are prohibited from being sold on the platform. These include counterfeit or imitation goods, items that are damaged or incomplete, items with unclear ownership or illegal provenance, and mass-produced low-value products that do not meet collector standards. Always review the prohibited items list before submitting your item to avoid rejection.

questions.question: Can I sell common household items?
questions.answer: No, common household items such as basic kitchenware, clothing without collectible value, or standard electronics are not suitable for auction. Our platform is dedicated to special, rare, or collectible items that appeal to a niche audience of buyers.

questions.question: Are replicas or reproductions allowed?
questions.answer: No, replicas, imitations, or counterfeit items are strictly prohibited. All items must be genuine and, where applicable, verifiable.

questions.question: Are modern luxury goods accepted?
questions.answer: Yes, but only if they are authentic and in excellent condition. Items like designer handbags, watches, and jewelry must include original certificates or proof of purchase to be accepted.

questions.question: Can I sell incomplete collections?
questions.answer: Incomplete sets or collections are generally discouraged unless individual pieces have significant value or rarity on their own.

questions.question: What about digital or virtual items?
questions.answer: At present, digital-only items (such as NFTs or game assets) are not accepted unless clearly listed in an approved digital collectibles category.

questions.question: What happens if my item is rejected?
questions.answer: If your item is rejected, you will be notified with the reason. Often, rejection occurs because it does not meet quality or rarity standards, or because the provided description or photographs were insufficient.

questions.question: Can I resubmit a rejected item?
questions.answer: Yes, if you improve your listing by adding better images, more details, or proof of authenticity, you may resubmit. However, some items may never qualify due to platform restrictions.

questions.question: Does item condition affect acceptance?
questions.answer: Yes, condition is critical. Items must generally be in good to excellent condition. Minor wear may be acceptable for antiques, but severe damage will result in rejection.

questions.question: Do I need expert verification before submitting?
questions.answer: While not required, expert verification (such as appraisals or authenticity checks) increases acceptance chances and adds trust for buyers.

questions.question: How detailed should my description be?
questions.answer: The more detailed the better. Include brand, maker, year, size, material, and condition. Provenance and background stories add credibility.

questions.question: How many photos should I upload?
questions.answer: Upload at least 3–5 high-quality photos. Include wide shots, detail shots, and any close-ups of signatures, marks, or flaws.

questions.question: What type of background should I use for photos?
questions.answer: Use a plain, neutral background (white or light gray works best) to keep the focus on your item.

questions.question: Should I mention flaws or defects?
questions.answer: Yes, always. Transparency builds trust. Mention scratches, chips, or missing parts, and show them in photos.

questions.question: Can I use stock images?
questions.answer: No, stock images are not allowed. You must provide real, original photos of the exact item you are selling.

questions.question: Do titles matter for presentation?
questions.answer: Yes, titles are key. Include brand, year, and unique features. For example: 'Rolex Submariner 1995 Stainless Steel with Original Box.'

questions.question: Do certificates of authenticity help?
questions.answer: Yes, they significantly increase desirability. Buyers are more confident when supporting documents are included.

questions.question: How important is provenance?
questions.answer: Very important. A clear ownership history adds value, especially for fine art, antiques, and collectibles.

questions.question: Do bidders prefer rare or high-quality items?
questions.answer: Both. Rare items spark excitement, while high-quality items with proof of authenticity create trust and strong bidding.

questions.question: Does packaging matter?
questions.answer: Yes, original packaging adds value, especially for watches, jewelry, and collectibles. It suggests better preservation and authenticity.

questions.question: Can marketing text help my listing?
questions.answer: Yes, engaging and detailed descriptions that highlight uniqueness, rarity, and condition can make your listing stand out.

questions.question: What are examples of prohibited items?
questions.answer: Examples include counterfeit goods, pirated media, ivory products, weapons, or items violating copyright laws.

questions.question: Can I sell damaged items?
questions.answer: No, heavily damaged or incomplete items are generally not accepted unless they are rare antiques where some damage is expected.

questions.question: Can I sell items without proof of ownership?
questions.answer: No, items with unclear or illegal provenance will be rejected. Proof of legitimate ownership is required.

questions.question: Are mass-produced collectibles allowed?
questions.answer: Not usually. Items like cheap modern toys or common fast-fashion clothing have little collector appeal and will not be accepted.

questions.question: What happens if I try to sell a prohibited item?
questions.answer: Your listing will be rejected, and repeated attempts can result in account suspension or permanent banning.
